sentences.sContent: Their new outpost was on the crest of a hill.
sentences.sContent_eng: Their new outpost was on the crest of a hill.
sentences.sCn: 他们新的前哨阵地设在一座小山包顶上。

sentences.sContent: Mr. Wang said he had personally visited every Disney resort in the world, with the exception of the Shanghai outpost.
sentences.sContent_eng: Mr. Wang said he had personally visited every Disney resort in the world, with the exception of the Shanghai outpost.
sentences.sCn: 王健林说，他亲自逛过全世界的每一个迪士尼度假区，只有这家迪士尼在上海的前哨基地除外。

sentences.sContent: He was assigned to a combat outpost, one of a number of smaller bases set up by foreign forces in Afghanistan, the officials said.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was assigned to a combat outpost, one of a number of smaller bases set up by foreign forces in Afghanistan, the officials said.
sentences.sCn: 这名士兵被分配到一个战斗前哨，该哨所是驻阿富汗外国部队建起的较小的军事基地中的一个。

synos.tran: 前哨；警戒部队；边区村落

remMethod.val: out(外面的) + post(岗位) → 靠外的岗位 → 前哨
